results.title: Adapt to change or leave the land
results.creator_credit: Tom Carroll, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: As Tom Carroll reflects on five generations of his family and their land at Mudgeegonga in northern Victoria. In doing so, he recalls the various challenges his ancestors faced, as well as the changes they needed to accomodate, much in the same way he has to today.

results.title: Adam Smith and The Wealth of Nations
results.creator_credit: John Haggarty, Jean Wadlow, Liberty Fund and Charles Barker Films
results.brief_description: Studies the life and works of Adam Smith, the Scottish political economist and philosopher whose book “The Wealth of Nations” was completed two hundred years ago. Outlines many of Smith’s most interesting and controversial theories.

results.title: Adam's rib
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, Lawrence Weingarten and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Katharine Hepburn plays Amanda Bonner, the defence attorney in the trial of Doris Attinger for the attempted murder of her husband whom she discovers has a mistress. Spencer Tracy is Amanda’s husband, Adam, prosecuting attorney in the same trial. As the trial progresses, Amanda and Adam find they cannot confine their battle to the courtroom, as the issues of sexual equality extend into their home. Also starring Judy Holliday and Tom Ewell.

results.title: Acupuncture: an exploration
results.creator_credit: Franklin Konigsberg, Permagum Productions and FilmFair Communications
results.brief_description: Describes current experiments confirming the effectiveness of acupuncture points. Theories are given explaining its success as an analgesic for surgery, also an outline on the history of acupuncture is briefly explained.

results.title: Acupuncture
results.creator_credit: Lin Sheng-Lung, Weng Jeng-Yih and Keta Communications
results.brief_description: Acupuncture and moxibustion in China have recorded histories of several thousand years. They are effective, convenient and safe treatments. Many people regard both treatments as one and the same, but they are in fact two distinct treatments that are often used together. Acupuncture is a corrective therapy and moxibustion is the burning of herbs on acupuncture points to bring healing relief. This is a in-depth analysis of these two healing methods, how they are applied and their increasing acceptance as efficacious treatments in Western medicine.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lin Sheng-Lung, Weng Jeng-Yih and Keta Communications

results.title: Actualization through assertion (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Barnett Addis, Robert Liberman, Larry King, University of California, Los Angeles and Behavioural Sciences Media Lab
results.brief_description: Four clients are seen in group assertion training, developing a style by practicing appropriate eye contact, gestures, body movement, touch, facial expression & voice tone & volume. Therapists are seen directing the client’s progress and reinforcing small successes. Practice assignments are given in which newly learned skills are applied to situations in the client’s daily lives. Narrated by McDonald Carey.

results.title: Acts of the Apostles
results.creator_credit: Roberto Rossellini and Don Bosco Multimedia
results.brief_description: This is a special catechetical edition of the film, running for almost 6 hours, and telling the story of the trials and tribulations of the Apostles of Jesus Christ from the immediate time after his crucifiction until the acceptance of the new religion of Christianity. The film is divided into 10 parts, the titles for the parts are: ‘Gift of the spirit: good news people’, ‘Jesus lives in his people’, ‘Witness to Jesus’, ‘Conversion and rebirth’, Salvation is open to all’, ‘Spreading the good news’, ‘A Tried faith’, ‘Sharing truth and love’, ‘People of the beatitudes’, ‘The Church: a unity of churches’. The film is dubbed in English.

results.title: Acts of God
results.brief_description: Takes an entertaining and informative look at freak weather conditions - commonly referred to as “Acts of God” - and at how the human body stands up to their violent effects. Shows the design of windproof structures and their effects on people and looks at designing to meet these problems.
